korean: 오늘 중요한 보고서에서 숫자를 잘못 적어서 상사한테 지적받았다.
회의 중에 보고하는데 갑자기 팀장님이 이 숫자 맞냐고 물으셨어.
다시 확인해보니까 진짜 틀렸더라. 완전 멘붕.
바로 수정해서 다시 제출했지만 한동안 기분이 안 좋았다.
동료가 괜찮다고 위로해줬지만 계속 신경 쓰였다.
오후에 업무하면서도 집중이 잘 안 됐어.
다음부터는 제출하기 전에 꼭 두세 번 확인해야겠다.
이런 실수 두 번 다시 안 하려고 노트에 적어놨다.
english: I made a mistake in an important report today and my boss called me out on it.
I was presenting in the meeting and suddenly my team leader asked if the numbers were correct.
My face turned red and I was so embarrassed.
I checked again and it really was wrong. Total panic mode.
I fixed it right away and resubmitted, but I felt terrible for a while.
I didn't even have an appetite during lunch.
A coworker tried to comfort me saying it's okay, but I kept thinking about it.
Even working in the afternoon, I couldn't really focus.
From now on, I need to double or triple-check everything before submitting.
I should make a checklist and go through each item one by one.
I wrote in my notebook that I won't make this mistake again.
On my way home, I promised myself I'd be more careful tomorrow.
